My Resume

A little about me...

My name is Albert Cao and I'm currently an undergraduate computer science student at the University of Michigan. Currently, I'm interested in exploring low-level programming, full-stack development, cyber security, and general software development opportunities.

The first time I discovered computer science, I found an outlet for my creativity and love for solving puzzles. While it's still that outlet for me even today, I've come to realize computer science has and will continue to shape the future. The more I dive deeper into the realm of programming, the more I realize its endless potential. Ultimately, I strive to be at the forefront of technological advancement where my ideas and work will help change lives for the better.

Away from the screen, I enjoy cooking, swimming, lifting, playing football/basketball/volleyball (basically any sport), and spending time with friends and family.

Thanks for visiting my website and learning a little bit about me! Feel free to take a look around and contact me whenever!

My Experience...

Newport Yacht Club

Taught children ages 2-5 the basics of swimming to develop patience and teaching skills

Mad4Chip

Worked with low-level programming to create libraries/drivers for various microprocessors

Nordstrom Rack

Click to check out the repository!
Instagram Clone

Instagram based client-side social media app. Built in React using Flask for backend, SQLite for database, AJAX for custom REST API.

Click to contact me about it!
Google Hadoop/MapReduce Clone

A multi-threaded program simulating a distributed MapReduce program. TCP/IP/UDP ports were used between managers/workers. Coded in Python.

Click to contact me about it!
Assembling and Simulating Single Cycle, Multi Cycle, and Pipline Processors

Wrote multiple assemblers and simulators for single cycle, multi cycle, and pipline processors based on the "Little Computer 2000" assembly language.

Click to contact me about it!
